text: we have had a stern warning from China
saying that those who play with fire
will perish by it this from the office
of Hong Kong and Macau let's take you to
Stephen McDonnell who is monitoring all
the process for us and was an amongst it
of course yesterday Steve good to see
you what can we read into these words
this pretty stern warning that we've had
from China in the past few hours
absolutely it was a threat from the
Chinese government really to the most
radical protesters that Beijing will not
tolerate this instability that at some
point that the threat would be them the
messages it will get involved and that
means the People's Liberation Army now
today he was asked about that and the
spokesman for that ministry from the
central government responsible for Hong
Kong said that for now they believe the
Hong Kong police can handle this so I
don't know that it's imminent however he
was sort of asked what would you rule it
out and then made it clear that people
should be no under no illusion that that
is not an option because he said that
these protesters shouldn't underestimate
Beijing's resolve nor that huge power
that it can bring to making sure that
this place is returned to order now the
interesting thing though he's saying on
the one hand that you know that the
government here that can handle it that
the police here can handle it however we
had a press conference from the police a
short while ago and one thing really
stood out for me I mean they mentioned
the arrests there lots of rest yesterday
148 people arrested but another figure
was until yesterday from like the 6th of
June until yesterday the police had
fired a thousand rounds of teargas now
yesterday only yesterday they fired 800
more so you can imagine that the you
know the extent of the street battle if
you could put it that way you know
yesterday and just how intense it was I
mean where we were around those quarters
where the police live that protesters
throwing dozens of bricks over the fence
smashing up the homes of police officers
and when you think about it and the
police coming out rut rubber bullets
heavy baton charges and this was only
one part of the city this is going on in
about ten or twelve different locations
around Hong Kong and right into the
night we know with brawls and again
involving people we think potentially
who are involved with triads and Steve
how much do you feel when you and
amongst it that the protests really have
been hijacked by these more sort of
hardline protesters I think what's
happened two things have happened that a
lot of these protests have become really
radicalized as the weeks have gone on
they're ramping up what they're prepared
to do and the police are ramping up but
how they're prepared to respond and the
protest is now coming they've got body
armor type stuff they've got face masks
for the gas they've got helmets they're
home made shields now at least started
off as a mass peaceful movement with
hundreds of thousands in the streets and
it is still a large proportion of people
and it's not the hundreds of thousands
but there are thousands and even
possibly tens of thousands of those
protesters who are prepared to go to
quite you know extreme lengths they
think the peaceful way hasn't worked the
government ignored that so in order to
get the democracy they think they
deserve they think that increasing
pressure will somehow deliver it now
it's not clear what their path is to
many observers and yet that is what they
have decided to do Steve thanks for
joining us from the streets of Hong Kong
Steve O'Donnell there
